column1: Today is Public Health Thank You Day! COVID-19 reminds us of the need to strengthen our public health capacity and support our public health workforce. A heartfelt thank you goes out to our nation’s frontline workers who are keeping us healthy during this pandemic. #PHTYD https://t.co/1VL5EYlPnC
New COVID-19 state orders go into effect tomorrow at 10:00 pm. Please wear a mask practice physical distancing and stay at home when possible. https://t.co/VSfV2PCwAz

#VenturaCounty has moved backed into the Purple Tier as COVID-19 cases continue to rise. As we navigate this difficult phase of the pandemic please do your part & abide by our public health officials' guidelines. We're in this fight to #StopTheSpread of the coronavirus together. https://t.co/7jkZUbvADS

Sadly we've reached a tragic milestone as the second state to reach 1 million diagnosed COVID-19 cases. It is everyone's responsibility to listen to our public health officials. Please keep physical distance wash your hands thoroughly and often and wear a mask. https://t.co/D4mf5ORVqt

This rushed confirmation is an awful disservice to the American people who deserved to have their voices heard. We should be focused on getting additional COVID-19 relief legislation passed #ForThePeople not rushing an appointment to the Supreme Court. https://t.co/s6GWdkzwZk

On #LaborDay we are reminded that American workers are the backbone of the prosperity of our nation. During this day of reflection we renew our commitment to fight for American workers – especially during the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/IwmSDEJzBp
Did you know America is facing a severe shortage of poll workers due to the COVID-19 pandemic? Sign up to be a poll worker on November 3 here: https://t.co/eFZfeQDwZT

Happy 85th birthday to Social Security! As older Americans and people with disabilities face the uncertainty of public health and the economic crisis during the #COVID19 pandemic we must protect and expand this critical lifeline #ForThePeople. https://t.co/IjhcQTAvCd

COVID-19 has hit child care providers and families hard forcing closures and exacerbating the shortage of quality affordable care. We cannot expect parents to return to work until we can safely reopen facilities and make childcare more affordable for families. https://t.co/Otw3PSN3wT

Today I chaired a hearing of the House Veterans’ Affairs Subcommittee on Health examining the quality of care and infection control practices at State Veterans Homes during the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/xigydj4Zhb

In May the House passed #HeroesAct to extend these unemployment benefits because we knew the crisis was far from over but Senate Republicans and President Trump have spent months twiddling their thumbs while COVID-19 has spread unchecked across our nation.
With millions of cases nationwide we have ALL been personally victimized by #COVID19. Mask up & stop the spread of this pandemic. #OnWednesdaysWeWearPink https://t.co/mnCK6bJDow

It is frustrating and disheartening to see our community back-sliding when it comes to stopping the spread of COVID-19. This disease is a serious deadly threat and has killed over 134000 Americans already. Please take the advice of CDC and public health officials seriously. https://t.co/oWVZIQLQi8

This week Governor Newsom ordered Californians to wear face coverings in public places and in high-risk settings. We all have a responsibility to do our part to prevent the spread of COVID-19 and face coverings play a big role in accomplishing that. https://t.co/gO3gplluFk

Today I voted for critically needed legislation that will provide additional funds to address the unprecedented health and economic crises brought on by #COVID19.  Read my full statement here⬇️  https://t.co/u94ArYfi1k

Recently I joined @RepMikeLevin @VetAffairsDems @MarkTakano & @DrPhilRoe to introduce bipartisan bicameral legislation to address personal financial losses that some military families have suffered as a result of the stop movement order issued in response to #COVID19. https://t.co/ZLbsYUoShs

CFPB FHFA & HUD have launched a Mortgage and Housing Assistance website to help Americans navigate their housing issues during the coronavirus pandemic. To learn more about mortgage relief options protections for renters and avoiding scams visit https://t.co/icezZRE3qB.

The newly formed Select Subcommittee on the Coronavirus Crisis will hold its first briefing today at 12pm PST. We will hear from a bipartisan group of key experts on the requirements for our country to safely reopen. Tune in here: https://t.co/WIiuNRu2hw

Yesterday I was pleased to join my colleagues on the House Veterans’ Affairs Committee for a bipartisan forum on veteran homelessness. The #COVID19 pandemic won’t stop us from continuing to fight for our nation’s veterans. https://t.co/i9zCOHjQiu

California has put together a great resource guide for immigrants who are worried about the unique ways the #COVID19 crisis affects them. Great information here on what services and public benefits are available:  https://t.co/5tsma8pJQs

This week I traveled back to DC to vote for critical relief legislation that will provide much needed funding for our small businesses and our healthcare providers across #VenturaCounty -- and across the country. #CoronavirusRelief https://t.co/MXaYkqOi8D

Recently I joined @RepBobbyRush in calling on @EPA to secure equal rights to clean air protections. Air pollution has not only contributed to the climate crisis but is linked to the lethality of COVID-19 in our most vulnerable communities. We need action now. https://t.co/zX77ykJFtE

While we must continue to bend the curve and stay at home to stop COVID-19 our state also needs to begin to think about the processes and procedures for our eventual re-opening.  Testing and contract tracing will be key.

As the rest of the U.S. has come to better understand the importance of our immigrant doctors farmworkers and other #essentialworkers  Trump wants to use #COVID19 to push for his extremist views and halt legal immigration. We can't let his message of hate and fear win.

#HeroHighlight: Because of #COVID19 @Houwelings_ is producing more food than there is demand but they're not laying off workers & not wasting any excess food. Instead they've been sending daily shipments of tomatoes to local food banks who are experiencing unprecedented demand. https://t.co/mZs4ABfg8B
Have you or someone you know recently recovered from COVID-19?  Please help find a treatment and encourage recovered patients to sign-up to donate blood or plasma: https://t.co/u6rVK1CXlk

As we wrap up another week of “staying well at home” our efforts in combating the #coronavirus are by no means over and my work for you continues both in Washington and here in #VenturaCounty. https://t.co/xoMRpc4Zpo
Many of us are wondering how to safely shop for groceries and other necessities during the COVID-19 pandemic. FDA has issued an update on best practices for consumers here: https://t.co/1Mm0HTf7yJ
There are many inaccurate rumors circulating on social media that seek to take advantage of the COVID-19 pandemic. Please beware of such scams!

In the middle of a global #pandemic we need to be supporting health organizations around the world not cutting their funding. @WHO is a critical partner in the fight against #coronavirus and @realDonaldTrump's decision to stop funding is dangerous. https://t.co/sRuPmHe4LW

Communities in our district need support now to combat #COVID19. I am supporting the Coronavirus #CommunityRelief Act to provide $250 billion in stabilization funds to help our local cities get through this crisis. https://t.co/2iEL5oOV5i

As Congress continues to work to provide relief to address the #COVID19 crisis we must ensure Americans have access to affordable healthcare. We must protect pensions & retirement security and we must pass a recovery bill to help create jobs & fix our crumbling infrastructure.

While the first #COVID19 relief bills are helping Congress must do more to help us get through this crisis. That’s why I am supporting: additional small business assistance; more resources for our healthcare system including national rapid testing and PPE.
California’s efforts in fighting the coronavirus seem to be working. We must continue to adhere to public health officials’ advice in order to continue to #flattenthecurve. https://t.co/b8EEDm0oyo
While our mitigation efforts to combat #COVID19 show early signs of working it is crucial that we continue to #stayapart as we enter a challenging week in #VenturaCounty. https://t.co/6u5vhHoIBc

Attention: Healthcare Providers! @CMSGov has expanded its Accelerated and Advance Payment Program to help healthcare providers and suppliers during the #COVID19 pandemic. For more information visit: https://t.co/yt06gvcvgA

El Consulado de México en Oxnard ha preparado una lista de recursos para las personas que han sido  afectadas económicamente o necesitan información sobre la situación del #COVID19. https://t.co/3NW9Xt26I7

In the midst of the #COVID19 pandemic we need to make sure that Americans suffering from chronic conditions like lupus and arthritis have access to the medications they need to survive. https://t.co/d4nMmjtVIC
Today on #WorldHealthDay it is important to recognize the incredible work healthcare professionals across the globe are doing to fight this #COVID19 pandemic. Today and every day we thank you!

Women’s Economic Ventures (WEV) is now offering a weekly WEV Works Webinar series each Wednesday from 9:00-11:00 AM discussing financial management and assistance programs during COVID-19. Video recordings are available on the WEV website: https://t.co/EFqkRgu8AU
Check out these helpful tips on how to shop for groceries while protecting yourself and others from coronavirus. https://t.co/AxsQMElYLB

If you work for a company with less than 500 employees you are now eligible for two weeks of fully paid sick leave if you come down with #COVID19. Your employer will be fully reimbursed by the government within 3 months.  Click the link for more details: https://t.co/szBDsNTNhN

The #CARESAct brings needed resources and support to Americans and small businesses suffering from the #COVID19 pandemic including: ✅ Grants ✅ Loans ✅ Unemployment Insurance ✅ Payroll taxes ✅ More https://t.co/is5n3Bc57P

On https://t.co/F3xHFZATX4 you can find resources and information including: 📖 COVID-19 Resource Guide 📜Legislation passed by Congress 💵 Economic Impact Payments 📝 Small Business Loans ⚠️ Updates on #COVID19

California’s public health officials released new guidance on the use of cloth face coverings to protect against COVID-19. The guidance does not require people to wear face coverings – and is not a substitute for social distancing and hand washing.  https://t.co/RCewnpOyYM

If you have a background in health care including if you're retired or in med school our community and our nation need you now more than ever. Please join CA's fight against #COVID19 by registering for #CAHealthCorps today. https://t.co/HPboPiQ8jv
This #COVID19 Resource Guide 📖 will help you understand all the benefits that are available to you and your community — and how to access them.  https://t.co/QfSHDHIQS3

The U.S. Department of Labor has published a Q&A with helpful information for businesses and individuals who may have questions about paid leave authorized under the #FamiliesFirst Coronavirus Response Act. https://t.co/2QtE3VvT9X
Protect yourself and your personal information from coronavirus scams! https://t.co/PUa6yjkT9B

By rolling back #CleanerCars standards in the midst of the #COVID19 crisis @realDonaldTrump and @EPAAWheeler are prioritizing polluters over public health and the economy and threatening the safety of the public.  https://t.co/YiZcVJXxhV

Attention Ventura County Residents! I urge everyone to listen to our medical experts and #stayhome. We all have a role to play in this #coronavirus pandemic to protect ourselves our families our friends and our neighbors. #slowthespread https://t.co/bS9ohjflSo

Federal assistance from the #CARESAct has already begun to flow. Recently @fema awarded $468 million to CA for state and local public response efforts. @HUDgov also announced the release of ≈$4.3 million for #CA26 and local communities most impacted by the #COVID19 crisis.

Los trabajadores de la salud están en la primera línea del combate contra el #COVID19. Ellos protegen a nuestras familias y seres queridos sin medida. Les doy las gracias por su servicio para mantenernos seguros y saludables.

Healthcare workers are on the front lines of America’s response to #COVID19. They are selflessly protecting our families and loved ones. Thank you so much for your service to keep us safe and healthy. https://t.co/x9XmgvuuYO
Due to the coronavirus public health emergency Metrolink is temporarily reducing service. Riders can sign up for alerts and stay up to date here: https://t.co/HHK0OX630T.

Tomorrow I am hosting a telephone town hall with local public health officials to provide an opportunity to discuss updates on COVID-19 and concerns facing members of our community. https://t.co/1PY9nbcUnY

Community health centers are on the frontline of the #coronavirus crisis. They are also in urgent need of funds for staffing supplies equipment and more. Congress must immediately pass a long-term authorization bill and provide additional emergency funding. https://t.co/mWzYmG4Qpd
Beware of coronavirus scams! The internet and social media are rife with false information and scams. Protect yourself and your personal information. https://t.co/uAPHqQMbRa

Yesterday Governor Newsom issued a statewide executive order to stay home except for essential purposes. California continues to lead the nation in its response to the coronavirus pandemic and I support the Governor’s efforts to combat this crisis.

As the country continues to navigate the coronavirus pandemic I am proud that the House and Senate quickly and unanimously passed legislation that will protect America’s veterans’ G.I. Bill educational benefits.  https://t.co/SP593Ek1RA

Gov. Newsom has set up a new 1 stop resource for COVID-19 resources: https://t.co/QkcYtT3aBt. The website highlights critical steps people can take to stay healthy & resources available to Californians impacted by the outbreak including paid sick leave & unemployment assistance https://t.co/Igm1S0lRAO

We must come together to alleviate the financial burden of our students across the nation who have been devastated by abrupt school closures. I’m proud to join a group of members calling on @BetsyDeVosED to protect students from the financial impacts of #COVID19. https://t.co/CxYBKUs0e1

I appreciate the outpouring of support and concern for my health and the health of my staff over the last several days. After 14 days of self-monitoring and practicing social distancing I am pleased to report that neither my staff nor I have shown any symptoms of the coronavirus

On Thursday I am hosting a telephone town hall with local public health officials to provide an opportunity to discuss updates on COVID-19 and concerns facing members of our community. https://t.co/nBfL5gyzab

Attention #CA26 Veterans! The County of Ventura Veteran Services is temporarily suspending all walk in services effective immediately in response to #COVID19.   Please contact their main office at (805) 477-5155 for assistance or to schedule an appointment.

Ventura County has set new guidelines to protect our community from the spread of #COVID19. Please read them and do your part to save lives and protect yourself and your family. https://t.co/5iVQxHLzxv

Mitigation efforts like social distancing can help us reduce the impact of #COVID19 and help ensure our healthcare system does not become overloaded. It is up to all of us to do our part to flatten the curve and save lives. https://t.co/eEPY4nCT4D

Last night the House passed the #FamiliesFirst Coronavirus Response Act with broad bipartisan support. This bill will help to ensure our communities have the support they need to weather this difficult time and people are able to care for themselves and their families.

.@HouseDemocrats’ #FamiliesFirst #Coronavirus Response Act delivers #ForThePeople: 🍲 Expands food assistance 💉 Establishes free testing 👪 Provides paid leave 💵 Supports strong unemployment benefits 👩‍⚕️ Protects frontline health workers https://t.co/TUFJa4Fgef

To protect the public from potential exposure to coronavirus the U.S. Capitol will be closed to tours through the end of March. If you have questions please do not hesitate to call my office at (805) 379-1779. https://t.co/naDVpr6ijd

Yesterday I was informed that an individual I met with last week in DC tested positive for COVID-19. I'm told that individual is self-quarantining & has informed public health officials. Out of an abundance I have decided to close our DC office for the week.
It is also very important to remember that the risk of COVID-19 to the general public remains low and most individuals who do get sick have very mild to moderate symptoms.

🏥 Pursuant to the authority given to HHS under the Affordable Care Act the coronavirus test has now been designated as an ‘essential health benefit’ so it must be covered by private insurance Medicare and Medicaid.

⚠ Yesterday Governor Newsom issued an emergency proclamation to help coordinate the state’s response to coronavirus.    🛑 Importantly to protect consumers the state will be addressing price gouging for medical supplies including for hand sanitizer.
🚨 Important updates from California on the #coronavirus. Thread ⬇

Today I was proud to vote to pass significant emergency appropriations legislation to combat the #coronavirus which I hope and expect the Senate to pass and the President to sign. https://t.co/pxq4CFbviJ

For the latest information on the current status of the coronavirus including what you can do to keep safe and to stay up to date with public health recommendations visit my website here ➡ https://t.co/F3xHFZSvlE
For up-to-date information on #coronavirus visit the @CDCgov here: https://t.co/5PwnbXfLEq.

Also it is important to reiterate that individuals quarantined at NBVC are American citizens who show no signs of #coronavirus. I’m told they are being quarantined during the incubation period to make sure they are not infected per @CDCgov protocols.
For up-to-date information on the coronavirus and tips on best practices visit ➡ https://t.co/8gzmZ646sZ

My top concern is the health and safety of our community. I have been in regular communication with our public health officials who are handling the coronavirus situation. I will continue to monitor this situation closely as it develops. https://t.co/afULKybfV3
